description:
This place is right across the street from my apartment, and I'm fat as a result.

The food isn't quite as good as San Tung up the street, but it's definitely damned tasty at the price point.

Everyone that works there is super friendly every time I come in.

Highly recommend the General's Chicken, Basil Chicken, Phoenix and Dragon, Hot and Sour Soup, Beef Chow Fun, Triple Crowns with Scallions, and the Spicy Garlic Fried Rice...but really I don't think I've ever had a bad dish here.
author: Joey K.

description:
This a good place if you're looking for something quick, cheap, and filling.  The food was okay.  Not amazing.  Just ok.  To be fair, I ordered the chicken with snow peas.  Maybe white meat and veggies are a blander dish in general, I don't know.  Probably they don't put MSG in the food, so maybe that's why it has a blander or milder taste, or it could have been what I ordered.  I'm not sure, but my chicken dish had a strangely shrimp-like aftertaste to it and something about the flavor mix just seemed a little odd.

Pros:
*Variety of veggies in the dish that I ordered.  The chicken with snow peas had wood ear mushrooms, water chestnuts, carrots, and onions in addition to the snow peas.
*Very fast service -  They had it ready in 2 minutes after I ordered (I was the only one in the restaurant at that point)
*Authentic - You can tell by the menu and the dining arrangement that this place is just a hole in the wall by people who know exactly what they're doing and are making authentic Chinese food the way they would make it back home
*Reasonably priced - My order came up to about $11 not including tip (I personally don't tip on to-go orders since I'm not getting table service)

Cons:
*I arrived a half hour prior to closing, and they told me it was "To Go Only".  They didn't want to bother with table service even though I had a half an hour.  It seems that most of their business in fact comes from GrubHub and other delivery services.  They practically seemed shocked that someone would actually walk into their restaurant to eat, and want to sit down.
*Food is okay.  Again, not great.  Just okay.  I'm out of my league here in trying to explain why.  I've had good Chinese and I've had great Chinese.  This wasn't bad.  But it wasn't great either.  

So again, if you're looking for fast, cheap, and filling, then this is the restaurant for you.  If you're looking to sit down somewhere nice and eat some of the best food in the city... maybe not.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Mongolian Beef - beef was tender, but a tad too salty for my taste
Honey Walnut Shrimp - was superb. Crunchy outside and soft in the inside.
Superb service, the guy helped us picked their popular dishes. Serving size was ample.
author: Steven C.

description:
WAY above average Chinese Service!

Mongolian beef was super yummy!! Tastes exactly like what Mongolian beef tastes like. Make sure you let them know whether you want a la carte or over rice. 

Went in as a group of 5 and our waiter patiently and willingly divided our tab for us. He was so nice and always ready to help us!! 

Would go again.
author: Ashley H.

description: I'm giving them a rating of 3 stars vs 4 bc of their egg rolls. It's horrible. No wonder they offer it for free if your order exceeds $25. Anyway! Avoid the egg rolls. Other than that, this restaurant serves decent traditional Chinese food. My only order the Mongolian Beef over Fried Rice since the other items we've tried were eh.
author: Sharon J.

description: We ordered the  egg rolls, Kung Pao tofu, and vegetable chow mein and they all tasted amazing.  The egg rolls were perfectly crispy and the tofu was just the right texture.  Portions were huge and the service was fantastic (lots of warm tea!).  The man running the joint was super nice.
author: Bianca P.

description: Came by because of a yelp add. Had the lunch special. The place has what Cantonese call "鍋器". The taste you get when your stir fry comes from a very hot & well used wok and comes to the table seconds out of the wok. I'm coming back.
author: Leung T.

description:
We order beef and broccoli, chicken chow mien and
Sweet and sour pork.
Everything arrived so hot!!!! Thats a big plus for us,as some restaurants delivery the food-only room temperature.
The food was all delicious and we will certainly order again.
author: B K.

description:
Bomb.com! It's a little hidden gem! 
I was actually a little nervous of what to expect as this place appeared to be older and a little dingy. To my surprise, the food was freakin' fresh as can be and soooooo flavorful. The little lady there was super sweet and gladly waited on us hand and foot. The price was great; not the typical high priced San Francisco eatery. Very pleased with our visit! 5 of us dined and were all extremely satisfied with our selections: Mongolian beef,  orange chicken, chicken lo mein, and cheese wantons.
author: Maureen S.

description: I have lived two blocked away from this restaurant for 27 years, I've never been interested to eat here, I thought it was americanized hot plate chinese food. Boy was I wrong. I went in there today for the first time and right off the bat the owner welcomed me very nicely. I wanna tell you I take a very dim view of any restaurant where they don't welcome you when you walk in,it is rude, and is bad business etiquette. I was so surprised of how nice and professional the owner (Benson) was. He was extremely patient, friendly and informative. I told him what I like and I dont like and he told me what would be good to order. That is a really good way to deal with your customers. I really enjoyed my meal, so did my friend I came with. We had shrimp dumplings, string beans with chicken and rice. I was really impressed.  I will certainly be going back next time and would recommend it to all my friends. Keep in mind this is a place to eat and has simple seating, mostly take out but is a real find. Highly recommend it. I feel so lucky I have this place around the corner and don't have to drive. By the way it has some meatless dishes there.
author: Sparky W.

description: This place has some delicious chinese food. I ordered the salt and pepper prawns, sweet and sour chicken, Mongolian beef, and Chow mein, and every single dish was delicious. The prawns were perfectly crispy and spicy. You can tell that the chicken is battered and fried before the sweet and sour sauce and veggies are added, which genius. Everything about this restaurant is great from the food to service. I ate lunch here everyday last week except Wednesday because they were closed, and Boy was I disappointed.
author: Joy S.

description: Then food and service was outstanding. They were so friendly and accommodating. We ordered 7 dishes...all were food except for the chicken. I can't remember which chicken dish it was but it was crunchy and dry with a red sauce...oh I think it was sweet n sour chicken. Everything else was great! Lastly, I read that they don't use msg in their food but I had a severe reaction to one of the dishes I ate. (Not sure which one) The next morning my eyes and face were puffy as heck. Took half a day for the swelling to subside. I want to eat there again but nervous... someone want to go with me??
author: D M.

description:
I love May Lees and I love that I didn't listen to any of the negative reviews.  They make deliciously flavorful Chinese food. It's not fancy, gourmet or a place to really sit and enjoy your meal BUT they are fast, the food is hot and they welcome modifications. 

I'm particular about my Chinese takeout and these guys a just what I was looking for. You can see fresh chopped garlic in your dish, the vegetables are bright and never over cooked, the meat has always been fresh cooked and exactly what it was supposed to be. 

They make killer WarWonTon soup, hot and sour soup, chicken and broccoli with real breast meat, their pork fried rice is exactly the kind you're looking for. 

I've had almost all the other neighborhood takeout and I found it to be too sweet, no flavor or just uninspired. 

May Lees...you nailed it for me. Thank you!
author: Lindsay D.

description: Very good!  Chicken chow-mien and sweet and sour pork. Not too greasy or oily. It was hot and freshly made the service was great ! I'm so picky when it comes to food so this was a plus for me.
author: Kristen C.

description:
Came in and had lunch. I was tired ... I'm not from SF.... I was just wanting some good food.. I got the combo plate with pork chow mein and honey walnut shrimp. The chow mein was soooo good!!! The shrimp were really good! I've never had shrimp so crispy! The only thing that I didn't like that the shrimp were a bit to soft as if they were undercooked and a little too shrimpy .... perhaps have the shrimp well done? Lol.. 

Anyways! Good little spot for some good food!
author: Jaisen A.

description: Ordered delivery via Caviar and was very pleasantly surprised. My wife and I ordered egg rolls, hot and sour soup, shrimp fried rice and general Taos chicken.  Our order arrived hot, on time and correct. All the food was excellent, not to salty. Extra shout out for the Hot and Sour soup, probably the best I've had in SF. A+
author: Nick G.

description:
The chef greeted me, served me a cup of jasmine tea without prompting, and suggested, upon my request, the Kung Pao beef.  I heartily agreed, and a few moments later he appeared with a delicious bowl of hot and sour soup. The soup was delicious, well balanced, flavorful but clear, and included fresh mushrooms. Very tasty!  

Before I could finish my soup, he brought a generous plate of dark brown Kung Pao beef with green and white onions, plenty for two people, and a plate of white rice. He asked if I liked it spicy and with onions, and I affirmed I did. The beef was tender and delicious, with flavors of peanut and red pepper, although the chef swore there was no peanut. Spicy, yes, but not so much that it covered the flavor. He was proud of his signature dish, and with very good reason!
author: Jeff R.

description: Great traditional Chinese food. Not a fancy place, but extremely welcoming and with amazing food.
author: Michel G.

description: I ordered delivery from this place last night. The driver was late and when he called me to pickup my food outside my house, he sounded angry, 'Come outside Now to pick up your food' then hung up. I didn't pay too much mind to it, but it was definitely off-putting. When I opened my front door he wasn't there, he was still inside his car which was double parked. I thought 'Ok thats a bit weird but maybe he wasn't sure which house was mine' so I went outside and stood on the sidewalk. He saw me, but still didn't get out of his car. Now I'm getting a little annoyed, but I was hungry and wanted my food so I went to the driver's side which was in the middle of the street. He finally opened his door and handed me the food telling me to sign the recipe and that next time I should order uber/lyft. I'm dumbfounded. Like the hell? I am ordering delivery for a reason. Never ordering from this place again. Never encountered a driver that was so fu*kig rude. Ruined my appetite and my whole night.
author: Stacy Y.

description:
I ordered food for delivery in the yelp app.  It was fast and efficient.  
The spicy green beans with tofu with incredible and possibly my new favorite dish.  The vegetarian pot stickers and the walnut prawns were good. The fortunate cookies were individually wrapped and quite good and fresh.  I wasn't sure how the delivery service would go but I'm glad I tried it because it was fast, efficient, correct order and my food was hot.  The time estimate was 45-60 minutes and the food got here in 45 minutes from the time I submitted the order online.  Pretty impressive.
author: Meghan J.

description:
Randomly stopped here because I was starving. I ordered the potstickers. Fresh and delicious! The food was made quickly and the people that work there were friendly. 
Oh, the bathroom was very clean too. That's a plus.
author: Chanell T.

description: My company delivers dinner from May Lee's and it's been fantastic. Any time I can have dim sum for dinner, I'm super excited (+ a trillion stars type of excitement). The dim sum is pretty tasty as well, better than some of the other casual dim sum spots in the Bay Area. I'm in some serious dim sum heaven whenever May Lee's is served!
author: Denise L.

description:
I used to work around the corner, and May Lee is one of the most affordable, quick lunch spots in the inner Sunset. Great portions, and standard Chinese fare with fresh ingredients and minimal grease. 

Faves include the fried crab cheese puffs, beef chow fun, wonton soup, and spicy string beans with tofu.

Always pay attention to my special requests, and delivery is super fast (and with a smile). Great little family business!
author: Sarah H.

description: Best chow mein I've ever had! Seriously so good. I also got the walnut shrimp, it was heaven. The restaurant itself is very low key and authentic, and the service was really nice. The guy actually chased us down the street because we forgot our box of leftovers on the table; I was not expecting that from a big city place! Definitely would recommend. Also the prices were super reasonable.
author: Rosa H.

description: Despite the 3.5 star rating May Lee's was delicious. The orange chicken was really tasty so was the chinese garlic greens. Plus they have a high health score in comparison to other chinese restaurants in the city. The only reason I did 4 stars was because I didn't like the egg rolls at all :( . But the other food was so good. Plus the delivery guy came here 30 minutes early.
author: Riley S.

description: Solid take out. Scratches your itch for chinese-american food if that's what you want. Sure there's a panda express two blocks away, but this is better for all the standards. It's not cheap, but it's not expensive either. Ordered online and food was ready in 20 min for pickup. Chow Mein (Lo Mein as I'm used to calling it) is great. General's (Tso's) chicken is pretty good. Not as spicy as I'd like, but still sweet and tangy. Dumplings are decent, a little pricy though. All in all great take out spot. Ambiance is extremely hole-in-the-wall. People working there are friendly.
author: Julian V.

description:
Some nights, you want to just pop into a dainty restaurant that has mellow beats playing in the background. Its food preparation is extolled in a tantalizing tale about how it's vegetables are picked at its absolutely peak ripeness down to the very minute. It's meat is prepared in such a way that the animal died in absolute bliss.

If that's one of your nights, I'd advise you to move along.

What this place offers, instead, is honest to God, tried and true, delicious Chinese food fresh from the wok. I recommend the Mongolian beef with rice! Take seven orders while you're at it! You'll need it! You'll understand when you bite into each savory morsal that is complimentes with a good amount of spice. As an added bonus, the onions help relieve congestion as well.

If you have an honest to God hunger that needs satisfying, and you need to be full now, give this place a go. They deliver everywhere within San Francisco. Even Treasure Island. How cool is that!
author: Henry H.

description: Was about to order, food has been good, except the last time. Now I see the Health Inspection Score took a dive. It's almost low enough to be shut down. I won't be ordering until it goes back up to 90 or above.
author: Pearl R.

description: We ordered the Kung Pao prawns and spicy Mongolian beef chow mein with a side of steamed rice for delivery. The food was plentiful and delicious! Nothing was overly salty and everything tasted the way that it should. The prawns were perfectly cooked and the meat in the chow mein was lean. We asked for the dishes medium spicy but we could have handled normal (note for next time!). We will definitely be ordering from them again; totally worth it! Enough food for two and we have leftovers :3
author: Christine A.

description: Food came quickly, and was pretty fresh.  Just wasn't a big fan of the flavors and textures to be honest.  Every place has their style, but this place wasn't my favorite.
author: Andrew P.

description: I love this restaurant . It's my go to for delicious Chinese food . Never fails . I loveee the chicken fried rice, the beef and broccoli, the sesame chicken and the list goes on. Also they always have fast and speedy delivery service and the delivery person is always so nice !! This is my favorite Chinese restaurant ! Ten stars ! I would definitely recommend this restaurant . :-)
author: maria f.

description: Never had a chance to order food. I called to place an order and ask a question and the woman said she was very busy, to look at the menu, and hung up on me. Now I'll never order from there... too bad :(
author: Michelle R.

description:
When you're really hung over and all that sounds good is a bunch of yummy Chinese takeout, this is the place! My roommate and I ordered all-fried-everything from May Lee's and it did not disappoint! The delivery was also faster than most places, which is always a plus! We ordered:

Fried Crab Cheese Puffs: These crab cheese wontons were large in size and very filling. Perfect for sharing! They were also still crunchy by the time they arrived to our house!

Orange Chicken: Great flavor and breading was not too heavy. The sauce wasn't too sticky either. The dish also included broccoli in it.

Sweet and Sour Chicken: Light breading, great portion size, and was served with bell pepper, onions, and pineapple.

Egg Fried Rice: Sooo good! The rice had great seasoning with pieces of egg, vegetables, and the portion size was huge! 

This place was great and I was very happy with the service. The pricing is also very reasonable! You get a lot of food for what you pay for!
author: Chisholm T.

description:
Delivery was timely. DRIVER WAS EXTREMELY RUDE. Meal was a 3.

The amount of the tip was really no big deal. I had been napping prior to getting the door. My tax was $1.10. 

1) I answered the door, he said nothing. I gave him two 20s and he asked me how much change I wanted. I really just wanted my change, not to have to do the math, to obtain it and calculate your tip - which is really why he's asking.

2) Excluding the change, I looked at the receipt, did the math and doubled the tax. I genuinely believe in gratuity, not entitlement. The only words he exchanged with me were to quarrel over the tip. I Gave him a stale look, handed him 2 more dollars and he went about his way. No please, no thank you, no greetings nor goodbye.

The roast duck is also grossly over salted. The food quality seems good but preparation fell short. I enjoyed the combo fried rice. They should probably pay their delivery drivers better or teach them etiquette. It's truly not about the petty few dollars, that's just the most disingenuous experience I've ever had with a delivery driver and he is your business' face.

Given my overall introduction, I'll probably get delivery elsewhere. Even just for the sake of satisfaction with whom I spend money with.
author: Brandon M.

description: Has it really been 8 years?  I did try this place again since the reviews seem to have improved and, yes, May Lee has changed how it cooks food.  They now use real vegetables, not frozen Birdseye.  Prices are pretty good.  I haven't done delivery, just order online and go pick it up.  It's good basic Chinese although I'm kind of wondering if they use MSG since I got one of those MSG headaches when eating their food.  I'm kind of surprised that on their menu they don't have Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce (love it) but I'm going to ask next time we order.  They ought to have orange slices, just out of cleaning your palate after a meal.
author: Kai T.

description:
This is by far the best Chinese food I have had in San Francisco in the two years I have lived here. I was in the neighborhood and was hungry so I walked in, and was seated right away. It was not busy and the server I had was a very sweet man. 

I decided on crab puffs, walnut prawns, beef and broccoli and a side of white rice. The waiter asked me if I was sure I wanted to order so much food. He was right! All of the dishes were very generous including the crab puffs. 

The food was delicious and came out in a prompt manner. When I couldn't finish the nice man took my leftovers and bagged them up for me. I told him I would review the restaurant on Yelp. I love finding local businesses where the people who work there are kind souls. I just ordered lunch here and am having it delivered. I can't wait!
author: Alex T.

description: Pretty good and consistent americanized Chinese food. It's not the best, but its far from the worst. Definitely a staple.
author: Eric S.

description:
Kinda disappointed with their food.
Order their food through GrubHub. App offered free Fried Wontons, but failed to mentioned that they are CHIPS, not the actual wontons. Knocked a star off because they failed to follow my instructions to call, not to ring the doorbell.

Their dumplings are really good, but not the Walnut Prawns. Wayyy too much iceberg lettuce and the ratio was basically small.
Go for the dumplings, skip the walnut prawns.
author: Shaymin N.

description:
I typically have the week between Christmas and New Year's off. That means on super lazy days, the roommate and I order delivery. A lot! In December 2012, I decided to revisit May Lee's. We ordered via GrubHub.

*Assorted appetizers ($9.95) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/may-lees-san-francisco#YTiu9cE3ChW2IURtMRoZyw
*Wor wonton soup (no carrots) $6.95 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/may-lees-san-francisco#VRI-QHLHtDF5hzyjgjmidw
*Salt & pepper pork rib ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/may-lees-san-francisco#tBxcf8l-ufCbVBWEcmtKEg
*Chow fun rice noodle with beef (dry style) $6.95 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/may-lees-san-francisco#W0PNfjU8RDMDH4uCVBnGlQ
*Happy family (no carrots) $10.95 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/may-lees-san-francisco#K6pj_HD_kjOptv52u0a2hw
*Free chicken fried rice with any order of $35 or more http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/may-lees-san-francisco#BIzwJ18FOV2dy80FTW24aw

I remember looking forward to the variety in May Lee's assorted apps. You get bbq pork ribs, egg rolls, potstickers, crab rangoon and fried shrimp. A nice selection. But the taste was lacking. The ribs were tough and the fried items were soggy by the time they got to our place. It was nice ordering through Grubhub though as we got free fried rice! Score!

Overall, pretty average Chinese food. I'd say everything was A-OK!
author: Elena N.

description:
REVIEW #400--speaking on behalf of my friends who are so devoted to May Lee's, they've been continuing to ask me to write this ever since I was on review #300.

[BACKGROUND]

From all the amazingness I've heard, I expected May Lee's to be a secret hole-in-the-wall that serves the magical secret family recipe Chinese food to die for; to be realistic, I would say it's a lesser-known hole-in-the-wall that serves better food than you'd expect.

You know how when you order at Panda Express, you expect it to taste like real Chinese food and it doesn't?  May Lee's offers a similar kind of stereotypical Chinese food menu of chow mein, Mongolian beef, general's chicken etc... except that unlike Panda, it actually tastes like real Chinese food! 

[FOOD]

I had intended to get the Mongolian beef because the pictures looked good, but I didn't pay attention to the captions and ended up accidentally getting the basil beef instead.  It turned out to be decent--not bad Sichaun style cooking, and I liked how it came with ample veggies, tofu, and a brown rice option.  It was a bit too oily for my tastes, but I guess the plus side is that it was filling enough to have easily fed me two meals.

If you're a picky eater, May Lee's is one of those Chinese restaurants that has a menu of endless choices--besides the typical Asian-American Chinese food (i.e. Panda menu), there is also legit Chinese food (like Singaporean fried noodles and moo shu), fancy Chinese food (like duck), and even a Japanese selection (though I'm not sure how good the sashimi is).  There are 20 lunch special options, all $8 and under including a spring roll, but no soup for take-out.  They also have reasonably priced catering trays--great for when you need to feed a lot of people for an event and you've brought Kiki's party trays too many times.

[SERVICE]

All of May Lee's staff were friendly and efficient, despite Chinese restaurants' notoriety for bad service (perhaps I had RBF and scrutinized every corner like a Yelper during my wait, so they were trying to impress me?)   In any case, it was nice of them to frequently keep me updated on when my food would be ready, and they gave me an extra menu so that I could call my order in next time.  I found it amusing that they cycled through Canto/Mandarin/English each time they spoke to me as if they couldn't remember.  (FYI they are decently fluent in all 3, though the Mandarin hilariously sounds somewhat Canto-accented).

[THE VERDICT]

Good Chinese food, especially for 1) when you need leftovers 2) when you need a party tray 3) when you want Panda Express-type food without the actual Panda Express
author: Edna C.

description:
The definition of Chinese fast food. The extra star is because I still ate most of it.

I read the yelp reviews on this place after I posted this, and yea, I was harassed for money too.
author: Abby Z.

description: May Lee has been consistently good. They obviously work hard to keep the customer happy. Pot stickers are delicious as is the Won Ton soup. They offer delivery from all of the various delivery services out there, not just from Yelp.
author: C S.

description:
Basic Chinese American fair. Not at all sloppy. Not too salty. All at very reasonable prices. We've gotten delivery a few times -- ridiculously FAST delivery!

Unfortunately they do not have gai lan, but they do have a lot of broccoli.  Very happy with this place.
author: Jason G.

description: I have been ordering food from May Lees for many years. They have been extremely fast, fair on price and even rather customer focuses whenever I would order. The food has always been quality and I'd always recommend it for someone that likes to order fast.
author: Gary G.

description:
The orange chicken  is awesome!
You definitely want to come to this restaurant! And it is really cheap!
author: Shuo Y.

description:
A friend turned me on to this place a few years ago, specifically for the spicy chicken & green bean dish (excellent!), and I'd say the Mongolian beef is above par as well, but the unfortunate experience with their delivery guy (3x now) has had an effect on my ability to recommend May Lee's for delivery. This dude shows up & claims that there's no tip, even though I know I added a $5 tip before checkout. Then he shows me a printout of the order which shows Tip: CASH. And I say No, let me run upstairs & get my phone (while the food is getting cold). So I show him the delivery receipt & clearly we have a discrepancy... he tries telling me that the $2 coupon is not on his paper (I can see that), and blahblahblah, ad infinitum... (I do not speak Chinese but I've been eating Chinese food in SF for over 30 years & I know a con man when I see one.) So THEN this guy gets on the phone (with the restaurant?) talking about another order--this is all part of the act to wear me down & get me to throw cash at him so he'll get out of my doorway--and yes, that is, in fact... what. I. do. 

I gave him the 4 bucks in my wallet & I will not be ordering from May Lee again. It feels like harassment just getting the food on my table... every time.

The food, BTW, is loaded with MSG, but that's typical -- won't kill ya. It's the real deal, above average Chinese food! :-/
author: Rebecca R.

description:
Do not order their sushi! I knew it would be a bad idea to order sushi from a chinese food place... people can't be great at everything, but I thought I'd have an open mind. I ordered the shrimp tempura roll to be safe. It was disgusting. I wish I could give you a better description than that, but that's what you get. Trust me, don't do it.

The sushi was ordered as an "appetizer" so we did get a regular Chinese takeout meal with it. Everything was as expected, nothing extraordinary but fine. I might go in or order a lunch special but not sure I'd get delivery again. It is the best option compared to a bunch of the other Chinese delivery in my area because of their health rating, which you can find on yelp. This place has very minor infractions compared to the disgusting notes left by health inspectors at the other restaurants.
author: Emma M.

description:
Eh, this place was okay. I like my Szechuan food to be spicy. I ordered the mapo tofu, and it was just okay. The tofu was extra extra firm, so it didn't quite soak up the flavor; the sauce was just on the outside. It was not spicy at all, even though I asked for the spiciest level they offer.
I also ordered the garlic Chinese green, which was bok choi with garlic and very tasty. I would order that again, but not the tofu.
author: Danielle C.

description: Ordered delivery. Average, to slightly below average Chinese-American food. Potsticker skin was pretty thick but tasty, orange chicken had a strange bitter, almost chemically taste. Ended up throwing away the leftovers instead of saving them for the next day. The packaging was all thoughfully organized and condiments and napkins were appreciated.
author: Ross R.

description: This place has very bold Szechuan style flavors.  The prices are reasonable, and the lunch special is amazing.  I love this place, it's my favorite Chinese spot in SF.  Everyone that I have ever brought here thinks it's delicious.  I just don't understand how they have bad reviews.  It's a small place that can't accommodate large groups, but anyone putting less than 3 stars is acting ignorant.
author: George O.

description: I've come quite a few times now, try their potsickers the best, completely filled and moist inside, and their mushroom chicken is good also. I say go for it mostly take out and a varied group of people good service both the guy and the lady, they know how to treat people and make one feel comfortable.
author: George T.

description:
Ordered a lunch meal and some sushi from them. While the lunch meal was ok the sushi rolls were not good for consumption. I had the spicy tuna roll and he tuna had clearly gone off. The avocado maki roll had brown over ripe avocado.
If you want the lunch meal go ahead it's decent for the price but keep away from their sushi
author: Sandra C.

description: Good quality meats. Breading not excessive. Though sauce still use some starch. Large portions. They deliver and give free chips for over $20. I will be coming back for delivery.
author: Robert S.

description: I give them 5 stars but what do I know about Chinese food? I'm a white boy. They are my neighbors so it's about convenience. The staff is very friendly. When I'm hungover or sick, their chicken hot & sour soup is healing to me. It replenishes me. They must think I'm nuts because I get the soup a lot. "This boy likes his soup," they must think. No, it's just healing my hangover. I do like this place though.
author: Michael R.

description:
Chow mein, fried rice, and orange chicken are my personal favorites. I love this place! Whenever I come to the city I make it a Must to eat here. Or I'll make a reason to come to the city just for it. 

Total hole in the wall! Go and eat then tell your friends!! It's a Big Bang for your buck!
author: Jamie C.

description:
Ordered for delivery, first time having any food from here. We had guests from out of state coming over, and I'm no cook, so I ordered from my Door Dash app. May Lee's prices were more reasonable than the other "fusion" restaurants that Door Dash picks up and delivers from. 

Had to feed 9 of us, so I ordered: Hong Kong Style Chow Mein, Beef w/ Veggies, Pork Ribs, Orange Chicken, rice, and pork buns for the kids. Cost me less than $72 with delivery and driver tip. We were all fed, plus I've had 2 meals myself from leftovers, and enough for 1 more meal. Not bad. That's 12 meals in all. 

I will order again.
author: Anio D.

description: Worst food. Owner is Mad AF when you ask antyhign twice. Tap Water is $4 (3 Glasses seriuosly??) Most of the food was RAW. Never Ever going again to this restuarant. Aviod if you can.
author: Mani G.

description: Extremely so-so in a city filled with delicious Chinese food.  I was craving Egg Foo Young and this is one of the only places I could find it on a menu...it was the worst thing we ordered.  The plus' for this place are that they are cheap and deliver quickly.  The end.
author: Jessica J.

description:
I got delivery. The food came in plastic containers, which made it soggy. :/ 
The egg rolls, however were crispy. Nothing looked liked the pictures on here that's for sure. I got the Szechwan fried beef and the crispy sesame chicken with fried rice, egg rolls, and a side of chicken chowmein. The fried rice was really awful but the chowmein was pretty good. I'm sure if you eat this food at the restaurant, or if they packaged it differently, it would be a 3.5 stars. 

Probably will not order again sadly. Delivery was super quick. And the price is right.
author: Alicia S.

description:
We are here on vacation and ordered delivery on our last night. Boy were we in shock when ordering. The website states $14 minimum order for delivery but when my husband called to plce the order he was told minimum was $50. That was doable, my husband mentioned the price on their website and was rudely told "no its $50.  The FALSE advertising is not right. When the order was delivered the guy had the nerve to ask for a tip. My husband and I both were sick within a few short hour. 
We will be back to SF but certainly will not order from here.
author: Kellie Jo C.

description:
I ordered their fried rice, deep fried garlic chicken and Mongolian beef!  
Everything was delicious.  Good food!
author: Sam F.

description: Got delivery from here, terrible service and mediocre food. The delivery man was late & extremely rude when giving us our food. He hung up the phone on us when calling & grabbed the receipt out of my friends hand walking away. Worst vegetable potstickers I've ever tried.. The ling lings potstickers from costco I make at home are 20x times better than the dry & tasteless ones we paid for. Only good part was the vegetable chowmein. Will not be ordering from here ever again.
author: K K.

description: I've passed this place a couple of times on walks. It's kind of a diamond in the rough. The food pictures on the outside were intriguing but no guests were inside so I got second thoughts. Tonight me and my roommate decided to go for it and I'm glad we did! The #1 and #5 were delicious! Generous portions and great presentation.  Also the guy serving us was super attentive and kind. Great customer service for sure!
author: Kristi G.

description:
Delivery is fast and always consistent! I love how May Lees dishes are over sauced and drenched in soy sauce. Yum. 

The dining room here is fugly. You can't really done in here. They always prep stuff on the dining tables. I don't come here for the ambiance.
author: Andrew V.

description:
Food
1.) Hot n sour soup - mmm nice and hot even tho we got it delivered, hit the spot on a chilly Sunday lunchtime, had especially lotta stuff in it like chunks of chicken which was kinda unusual 
2.) Combo chow mein - beef shrimp chicken wish it had veggies in it, maybe I'll ask to add that in next time, but otherwise everything tasted good standard soft greasy  chow mein nom nom

SERVICE
ordered delivery, it starts at 1130 which is a lil late for lunch bc it takes like 40 to 50 min to deliver and I can get hungry at like 11. But still, for being lazy, delivery was a good idea and it's nice they even provide it

12.15.13
author: Angela L.

description: This is our to go Chinese delivery.  Everything is always hot and fresh.  4 Stars because there is often MORE vegetable and less meat/fish than expected.  Very fast delivery and nice people.
author: Alston L.

description:
I've been getting take out from  May Lees for several years. They are so fast it's ridiculous! Sometimes my food is delivered 15-20 minutes after I hang up. Given, I only live a couple blocks away, but STILL. That's some seriously speedy delivery. The Walnut Prawn are awesome! May Lees Veggies are Awesome! The Chow Mein is really good. 

I normally get 2 entrees and 3 appetizers for my husband, son & I it runs just over $30 (including delivery & tip) and it's a ton of food. 

Great choice for quick delivery and totally hits the spot when you're having a craving for Chinese food. 

I have tried the sushi here before, and I wouldn't take that route again.  Stick to the Chef's Specials ;-)
author: Jessica C.

description:
Ordered delivery: it was super fast and the foodwas still hot. The food: combination rice good taste but almost no meat or shrimps, porkdim sum suuuuper good love them!, fried crab cheese puffs are regular, well I guees it depends on your taste, it doesn't have much cheese but you can taste more the crab so that's nice. 
Overall is a good place and will definitely order again
author: Amy S.

description:
1.  This is a review of delivery from  May Lee's Chinese and Japanese Restaurant.

2.  Easy to order on Grubhub.com.

3.  General's Chicken - This was a very bland version of the dish.  Even though I do not eat broccoli, it looked very overcooked.  I requested sides of hot sauce.  They delivered this.  I added it.  and that pepped it up.  The chicken was tender and the coating as crisp.

http://tinyurl.com/3pwt74m

4.  Mongolian Beef - This was pretty tasty and, even more so, when I added the hot sauce.  The meet was tender.  The vegetables were fresh and crisp.  I enjoyed it.

http://tinyurl.com/3sfm6gw

5.  The rice was perfectly cooked.

6.  For a Chinese restaurant, the order minimum is relatively high ($20).  There isn't a delivery fee.

7.  For some reason, even though the food looked relatively well packed, there were a number  of leaks and it was messy.

8.  Their prices are just slightly high in comparison to many options for Chinese delivery.

1  General's Chicken  $ 7.95
2  Steamed Rice  $ 2.50
1  Mongolian Beef  $ 8.75
2  Coke  $ 2.50
2  Sprite  $ 2.50
Subtotal  $24.20
Tax  $2.30
Total  $26.50

9.  The order was placed at 4:37 pm.  It was delivered at 5:20 pm.  So, it came in at under an hour.  The delivery person was professional and polite.

10.  Overall, this was more of a 2.5 star experience instead of a 3 star experience.  The food was inconsistent.   I only ordered from the Chinese portion of the menu.  They also have a full Japanese menu.  If there were not so many other  options, in a pinch, I would order from them again.  

11.  My fortune -  "If you do not have time to live your life today, when do you?

12.  My lucky numbers -  9, 38, 13, 55, 34, 12
author: Mark D.

description: Really great for delivery! Good food, fast delivery, also had sushi so you can't beat it. I definitely recommend!
author: Michaela O.

description: I absolutely love May Lees. By far the best chow mein I've ever had. My girlfriend and I come to the city from San Jose just to get May Lees. The workers are extremely friendly and hospitable. I highly recommend may lees
author: Mandy G.

description:
This is the chinese restaurant that I have always been missing in a college town. I've been to CMU, UCB, UCLA and chinese food was never really a great presence. But May Lee's just blew me out of the water. The lunch specials are cheap. Reviews love the delivery service. The food reminds me of chinatown restaurants.

I wish all college towns had a good chinese restaurant like May Lee's.

I ordered the Mongolian beef over rice lunch special. It came with some really hot and really spice soup and an egg roll. I liked everything about my meal. The hot and sour soup was well done and the mongolian beef was strong and meaty with plenty of onions.
author: Milki M.

description:
The sashimi I got was INEDIBLE. 

The salmon was frozen solid. Literally: it was 3 or 4 little bricks of salmon (hard to tell) all frozen together. For $6.50. The tuna was also covered with ice crystals, had to be picked apart from each other, and had a green marble sheen  to it. They left out the Hamachi entirely. 

The rolls weren't much better. The rice was gummy, the avocado rock hard, the shrimp flavorless, the seaweed mushy.  The free chicken fried rice tasted good but I was sluggish and tired and thirsty after eating it-- sure sign of a heaping dose of MSG, but I can't be sure.

On top of all that, they took 1.5 hours to deliver! Despite saying it would be 40 minutes. The delivery person was very kind and apologetic, but also said the problem is that I live "so far away." Well, maybe don't offer to deliver that far then!!

I could forgive the late delivery if the food was good, but it was VILE.  Sorry guys. Maybe stick to Chinese food?
author: Dina G.

description:
ONLY ORDER DELIVERY, my goodness this place needs to change the description to to-go only because there was no such thing as a server at this location. By far the most inaccurate review I've read on yelp when me and my friends decided to eat at this place. The person did not greet us, did not give us water, did not give us a menu, we asked for glass of water and he said its self served and to grab the beverage out of the fridge (????? really??) I usually like giving unbiased opinions that aren't formulated from a single experience but boy was this unpleasant. The man seemed rude and I'm the same ethnicity as him! i speak Chinese also he just seemed like he didn't want us there. When the food came out he literally dropped the plate in front of us I mean (bang on the table drop) after finishing the glass of water there was no more for us to refill so we asked him for some from the kitchen, oh yeah that water never came. Needless to say my friends and I ate quickly and went to starbucks next door since the business seemed to not want our business. 

Rarely do I feel I need to be opinionated about an experience but there was no dine in experience like this before, self served everything had grab the menu from the table, grab our own drinks, and after we got the food not once did he speak to us. We practically had to lean over the counter to look for someone to pay the tab since there was no one in sight.

Oh and lets comment on the chow mein that I ordered, the onion was not cooked I mean I literally felt like I eating a onion that was just cut. 

This place is so bad that it doesn't deserve a star or a review. If you're coming back from hiking and want a place to eat THIS IS NOT THE PLACE.
author: Bond L.

description:
Just about entered a food coma last night from pigging out on another round of delivery from May Lee's. We still have never been disappointed. 

Dat egg foo yung tho!! So scrummy yummy licious.
author: Cassie H.

description:
After living in Inner Sunset for over a year and walking past May Lee's Restaurant a countless number of times, I decided that it was time to finally try it out.  I got an order of chicken fried rice for take-out and from the time I ordered it, to the time I walked over to pick it up, it was already packaged and bagged with a fork and fortune cookie.  

The chicken fried rice ($4.25): seems like a deal and was more than enough for me. The rice was a little bit mushier than I was expecting, but it was still good (then again, I was pretty hungry at the time, so maybe my opinion was a bit skewed).  There was a fair amount of chicken and I really can't complain for the price (they pack a lot of rice into the take-out box).  

I probably won't be going back soon, but it's nice to know that this is an option- especially for delivery.
author: Samantha L.

description: Got them delivery, and the guy practically stumbled up my stairs; he had to have been drunk. I asked for general tsao's chicken, green onion pancake, and won ton soup. The only thing that was edible was the soup. The chicken was slop, the batter was sliding off and gooey, the green online pancake had no green onion, and they ignored my request for peanut sauce and instead gave me radioactive looking sweet and sour sauce. Honestly the only thing I enjoyed was the soup broth. Never ordering from here again....
author: Dylan D.

description:
AMAZING food for such an affordable price!! Delivery always gets to my house within 30 minutes.

My usual is the Mongolian Beef and it is always delicious. Just the right amount of onions and beef. Cannot go wrong!! 

Not sure why they are listed as closed on Saturday and Sunday, but they are definitely open during the weekends.
author: Tina T.

description: My favorite Chinese food in San Francisco!  They are delicious, cheap, and deliver in the speed of light!
author: Suzanna F.

description: The best, extremely cheap, lightening fast Americanized takeout Chinese food in the City-trust.
author: Antoinette S.

description: Best hot and sour soup I have ever had. I get it anytime I'm feeling really sick. It has the right combination of flavors and very fresh mushrooms and veggies. It definitely has that "smells like a barn but in a good way" special stink that hot and sour soup should have. I'm starting to feel better already.
author: Brittany H.

description: Simply the best food, delivery service.  I seriously after being in this hood for so long.  I have tried others BUT nope this is my forever place.
author: Karolyn H.

description:
I ordered this online and they got here in 45 minutes, on a Friday! I entered in the delivery comments to call me when they got here since I live in the basement. The delivery man called me complaining that he had been waiting outside for a long time and had been knocking on the front door. Uhm.. delivery comments are there for a reason, sir.

After the dilemma with the delivery man I was a little worried if the food would be good or not. It was actually delicious!
Here's what I ordered:
seaweed salad - nothing special, what I expected
fried chicken strips - I'm a southerner with a craving, and this hit the spot! 
fried california roll - it was huge! and good
and eggplant with tofu - mmmmmmmm delish

The food made up for everything, I'll definitely order from here again. Hopefully there won't be anymore miscommunication :)
author: Brittany B.

description:
I got their chef selection 8 piece sushi special.

Well not a single piece of Tuna and a full half of it was a very marginal salmon.  

Needless to say don't leave anything up to the Chef.  He will give you the cheapest crap he can.
author: Brian J.

description:
Ordered :
Mongolian Chicken Lunch Special : 3/5. Chicken was too rubbery, order something else.
Chicken Teriyaki Lunch with Rice and Salad : 4/5 . Teriyaki sauce wasn't enough, ask for some more. 
Salt and Pepper Chicken Lunch Special : 5/5 . Loved this

Will order again : 4/5 . YES
author: Rachit A.

description: Great place! Great people and they work very fast. My favorites would be the salt and pepper pork and walnut prawns. Really good Chinese food spot to go if you are in the mood for some authentic Chinese dishes.
author: Dave Y.

description: More of a delivery place but I think they will drive far if you order enough. Chinese and Japanese food. Try the vegetarian appetizer combo, soft shell crab and the deep-fried California Roll.
author: Ari M.

description: Grew up eating here. Affordable and yummy! Their chow mein and unagi and CA roll sushi is delicious. Totally worth it! :) I go whenever when possible and it's affordable for a student like me,
author: Aria Y.

description:
Ordered online, mid-evening on a monday. 

We got Ginger Lamb, a California Roll, a Dragon Roll, and Crab Rangoon.

Food was decent, nothing to write home about but not bad. I had expected the sushi to be sub-par, as most hybrid chinese-sushi places tend to be mediocre at best. The Dragon Roll was actually pretty decent. Not the best I've had, but certainly not the worst. Healthy sized, too. The California Roll was not as good, but better than expected (and free, as we had an order over $28). The Lamb Ginger was standard-fare. Lots of crab rangoon with the order. 

We also ordered a $2 mango pudding to push us over the $28 limit for the free CA roll. Major let down, it was just a small little pudding-cup sized prepackaged thing. Not worth 25c, let alone $2. 

I think my review leans around the lower end of 3.5, but I'm rounding them up to 4 because delivery was quick, and the deliveryman met me with a smile. 

I will be ordering from them again.
author: Mike M.

description: This is my go to greasy chinese delivery spot!  Never dine in...hahaha!  But the food is actually really good (drenched in grease, but good).  My go-to's are wonton soup, hunan chicken (a lot of veggies too) and pork fried rice.  Service is what you would expect from a hole in the wall Chinese spot...but c'mon that's not what you look for when ordering cheap chinese food.  Delivery is always super speedy (the delivery man now knows are dog by name)!  And it's cheap!!!  Definitely the best in Inner Sunset.
author: Rachael M.

description: Friends ordered chinese food for delivery on sunday. I had the beef chow fun. Pretty good. Menu is huge. Too huge IMO.
author: Pickle R.

description:
I have been consistently ordering Chinese delivery from May Lee's for over 6 years and have always been very satisfied with the food and the service. I have never ordered Japanese food from them, but the Chinese is solid.
Their website is quick and easy to order from, the food comes quickly (to the Inner Sunset, at least) and always tastes good. Affordable, fast and tasty - it's a win.
author: Ben G.

description: I really enjoyed the delicious hot food we ordered.  Hadn't had food from here in over 10 years. It's better than what I remember. We ate inside, it's more of a take out. But they served us limitless hot tea and made our order to perfection.  All for a decent price !
author: Sf-Nyc N.

description: Live this place. Looks like a hole in the wall kind if place but the food is good and the people are really nice. I love the lunch special. $7 for a giant plate of food plus usually an egg roll and soup.
author: Theresa S.

description:
I've always ordered delivery from this restaurant.  The food comes fairly quick ... about 45 mins total from when I hang up the phone.  The food itself always came nice and warm so it always seemed as though it was served right out the kitchen.

The most recent time we ordered from this place we received the wrong order.  We called in and they offered no way to switch the food out or compensation.  The man apologized once and sounded as though he was ready to yell at someone about the mistake.

Also we ordered the Sweet & Sour Soup twice, and both times it was disgusting.  So don't waste your money.

If I every order from here again it would be their honey-walnut prawns and some noodle dish -- and I would check my order before letting the delivery guy leave with my money.

I have yet to try food from their Japanese menu, but when/if I do I will update my review.
author: Pia V.

description: I've been getting take out for many years & enjoyed the food. The stuff I got tonight was awful. I immediately thought they must have changed ownership. What a disappointment
author: Robin H.

description:
When craving the occasional chinese delivery, my boyfriend and I always order from May Lee's. Their delivery is usually right on time, not to long and not super quick. We usually get the same thing every time we order, chicken w/ string beans, crab cheese puffs, kung pow chicken, and a sushi roll. Comes out to around $40 including tip for the driver. Good thing about May Lee's is that they have coupon deals for different amounts that you spend. We usually use the coupon code for $30 which is free chicken fried rice or chicken chow mein. Don't get the lemon chicken, onion pancakes, or mandrin (mandarin?) chicken wings, Baddd. 

11/11/12

we placed an online order through May lee's website and the time was 7pm we waited until 8:05 before we called them. They are on 7th we live on 20th and from previous times we ordered it usually takes around 35-45 mins for them to show up. When May Lee's picked up the phone we asked them what the current status of our deliver was, they said that they had some back orders so they are running late but the driver is on the way. 20 mins later the food arrives so totally time 1 hour and 25 mins. We unpack everything and notice that they left out an item so we call back and the May Lee's said oh sorry let me take down your phone number and address and we will give it to you for free the next time you order. Didn't want to start an argument so w/e, forget it. The other food items were all okay, we got the mandrin chicken wings and it was edible, but upon eating the 3rd wing there was something on the chicken and it was soo stringy and stiff, couldn't figure out what it was. 

- 1 star : really greasy
- 1 star : never reading the comment box (every time i leave a comment seems to be disregarded) 
- 1 star : some times the chicken has a subtle taste to it that makes me second guess the freshness.
+ 1 star : big portions, a bang for your buck
+ 1 star : cheap and has coupon deals

i'll post again if i decided to order from them again, and see if they actually remember  to include my "free" (since i already paid for it) item.
author: Lily S.

description:
My boyfriend got food poisoning from the food here.

He ordered delivery to my apartment in San Francisco, hesitated with the chicken because he had to stab it with a fork, it was pretty rock hard but decided to eat it anyway. All the food was bland and just had a odd taste. 

... A few hours later he was on the toilet. All. Night.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I've been eating hear since high school because of their lunch specials and continued eating here due to my limited college budget. Anything over rice with an eggroll on the side, for under $7!!! Sounds good to me!  

Now I eat here because I find the food very flavorful, they offer large portions and because of the fast delivery. On a cold or rainy or just plain lazy SF day, my BF and I order our typical general's chicken, chicken with broccoli, and something random, to satisfy our chinese craving, hungry tummies.  On our more ambitious days, we'll order take out and eat in GGPark.  Makes for a nice afternoon.

However, sometimes, something that wasnt spicy, is spicy the next time I order it.  Strange, but I like spicy so I dont mind.  

Side note: I attended a graduation party that catered from here, and the food (in banquet style portions) was just as delicious and fresh as ordering home delivery portions.  Even after an hour after delivery the egg rolls were still nice and crispy and no soggy veggies in the other dishes.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: This place has big servings of excellent, very tasty greasy Chinese fare. We love the Sweet and Sour Chicken, Sizzling Rice Soup, Sesame Chicken, Egg Rolls, and Potstickers... I have had many things off the menu at this place and all are good, albeit pretty greasy. They deliver all over, and offer take out. I wouldn't recommend dining in. The 'dining area' is dingy and dirty.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Called them back because the green onion pancakes were greasy, thick and hard crunchy.  Not crispy.  I mean crunchy break a tooth obviously either an old order reheated or I don't know.  They said they would credit my account.  Great no problem.  Then Halfway through my dinner I realized there were zero cashews in my cashew chicken.  I called to let them know expecting something more than "I'm sorry".  If they would have said or done something about this I wouldn't post because everyone has an off day.  Yeah it was very sub par and I have to remember not to order from here again.  Sigh.  Should have just cooked or got a pizza.
author: marie s.

description: Awful. Simply awful. The sushi is simply inedible. I ordered 55$ worth of food and not a single dish was tasty. Delivery was quick, but the food is simply disgusting, tasteless, awfully greasy, and overall unacceptable. This place is terrible. Do not eat here if you have an elevated sense of taste, because it is quite bad.
author: Anon E.

description:
This review is for their delivery, so I can't really say much about their in-restaurant experience.

I work in what is possibly the most inconvenient, drab neighborhood in San Francisco: Treasure Island.  Restaurants HATE delivering to the Island, and when I am stuck in the office alone, I can't go anywhere to get food.

Lo and behold, my coworker once ordered from May Lee's and left their to-go/delivery menu on my desk.  After realizing that a cup-o-noodles just wasn't going to do it for me, I dialed their # and decided to place an order.

Depending on where you are, the minimum ranges from $10-30.  For me, since I'm located in the middle of the bay, I had to ring up a total of $30, plus they had to throw in an extra $4 because it's, well, in the middle of the bay.  So really the total had to only be $26.  Knowing that Japanese food is more expensive than Chinese food, I decided to go with that, rather than order like 18 things of Chinese food.

I ordered a rainbow roll ($9.95), edamame ($3.25), salmon sashimi (8 pc. for $10.95) and a spicy tuna roll ($5.75).  Tax and tip and everything came out to a little over $40, which is pretty decent for the amount of food I got, plus the convenience of not having to leave my office.

When they delivered the bag, I found 3 pairs of chopsticks.  Way to go for making me feel like a fatty.

Surprisingly their sushi was very good and fresh.  The salmon sashimi was a good size, and everything was still chilled (probably helped that it was cold outside).  The rainbow roll and spicy tuna roll were both decent as well, and my only complaint was with the edamame, which was generally flavorless.

All in all, plus points for being friendly, fast and relatively cheap.  More bonus points for delivering to Treasure Island and taking credit cards.  The whole process was super simple, and I'll definitely be ordering from them again when I feel hunger pangs at work!
author: Tori S.

description: This restaurant has delicious, tasty Chinese food, with fresh ingredients.  We get food delivered from them all the time, it's our guilty pleasure, and I would keep ordering food from them. However, the reason I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 5, is that they have gotten my orders wrong about 30% of the time (gave me beef instead of chicken, broccoli instead of tofu, etc).  We ordered everything online so I know they definiltey got the correct item names sent to them online, I just wish they would pay attention to the details a little more.  Honestly, I so wish I can give them 4 or 5 stars, because I really do like their food and the delivery service is consistent, but it's incredibly frustrating when you pay for delivered food then realized it's not what you ordered. So, if you're not picky and just want some good Chinese food, this is the perfect place.  Otherwise, maybe try their dine-in option or get takeout and check the food before you leave the restaurant!
author: Sarah W.

description: Just got delivery from here.  Delivery was right on time, and price was totally reasonable.  Honey and I just scarfed down some of the food, and it was really yummy!  Try the salt and pepper Pork Ribs - YUM.  Portions are huge (tempura was bursting out of the box), so we ended up putting half the order away for tomorrow.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I went here a few weeks ago with a friend and I was very impressed with the quality of food. I ordered the Garlic Eggplant with Fried Rice and it was delicious! The restaurant staff were very sweet and accommodating, making sure to check in with me on the food and serving me hot tea. I was impressed that their restaurant served both Chinese and Japenese food and deliveries widely in SF. I will surely be back!
author: Sarah L.

description: Was desperate for sushi delivery. Which I only know of ONE place that does it right...Noriega Teriyaki. Sadly they were not delivering until 5 and it was 1...sigh. So I reached into the cabinet for the random flyers I collect for moments like this. So I ordered the rainbow roll, house roll, and dragon roll. It was not bad. not grrrreat, but good. A bit too much rice on the rolls for my liking but the fresh was fresh enough. However it was expensive. I know sushi is expensive but the guy added in his own tip and it came out to be a lot more than I thought. Not horrible but I would probably not do again, unless I was in the same desperate situation.
author: Chelsey G.

description: So just wanted to say I tried May Lee's once more yesterday because I was hungover and wanted Chinese and Sushi.  The Sushi has gone very downhill.  I will most likely not order from them again.  When I first moved to the city I thought they were good.  Yesterday I realized it's not even worth it, Chinese is so-so and Sushi has gotten almost as low as say a 7-11 level.
author: Nirea S.

description:
We thought we would try a new Chinese place in the neighborhood, and we will definitely not be ordering again.

Everything tasted like it was reheated (a bit stale an tough) and the Duck was inedible - we actually threw away the entire thing after one bite... :(

There are far better Chinese joints out there, and next time I will be ordering from them.
author: Julie W.

description:
heading back to our house and needed something to eat. we decided on chinese, but from where... well we happened to drive by and went on in. i suggested san tung but bf said it was expensive, i told him he was crazy, but gave in.
we had 15mins to closing and they let us eat in. i got the beef and broccoli. he ordered the walnut prawns. and also shared some pot stickers. 
pot stickers= yummy
walnut prawns- FYI your 'special sweet cream sauce' tasted just like that familiar ol' tarter sauce. don't get me wrong, it hit the spot, just dont try to play it up. My bf sometimes asks a server what he likes, he suggested that most people like this. I think he picked it because it was more $$...
beef/ broccoli- stickier sauce than i prefer. broccoli was delicious. 

we went, we dined. if i lived in the area i would possibly order take out.
author: Abigail W.

description:
This place had left some brochures in the lobby of my apartment. My girlfriend and I  thought we would give them a shot. 

Terrible.  
Rice was gummy and old, egg rolls were sitting in a half inch of oil. no joke. These things were looked as if they were soaking in oil all day. Could not eat a bite. The entrees were no better. Complete waste of money.
author: Kris J.

description: By far the worst delivery experience ever. It took him 30 minutes after he first called to find my apartment when intentionally wrote special instructions. The diver continued to hang up and ignore my call. Upon meeting him he was rude and shook his head at me like i was in the wrong.When I finally got the food it was tasteless and cold. I
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Saturday, 2:30 pm, STarving and on a glum quest to find vegetarian chow mein for under seven bucks, May Lee's shined through and came to my delicious rescue. I wanted to try San Tung but it was bursting at the seams with people, hungry Chinese people. I hope I can try it someday. I tried Golden Chopsticks across the street but they were only offering their lunch menu. Tracing back my footsteps back to 7th ave I kneel at the wooden menu board and make my decision, veggie chow mein and veggie egg rolls please. Ten minutes later two piping hot boxes of yummy are nestled in my arms and I march diligently back through Kezar Stadium, back up steep Stanyan, and back to my warm nest. This travel took about 25 minutes and when I unfolded the boxes I received a wok breath facial from the hot steam. 
I've decided cheap, greasy, fast American-Chinese food simply tastes best on an empty stomach and low debit account. I think this is the best veggie chow mein I've ever tasted chock full of mushroom slices, crunchy water chestnut. broccoli, celery, gai lan, and cabbage. I asked for them to make it spicy and they make it spicy. The only thing I'm bummed about was the lack of duck sauce to slather my veggie egg rolls in. Regardless, they were neat and tasty and less than $1 each. 

I wonder why they serve Japanese food too? Perhaps they thought it would be a good idea to offer cheap American-Japanese food... May Lee's is a solid male dominated operation... despite the flower vases on the dining tables and the statue of the Buddha in the back, I felt like a woman's touch could be helpful.

mmmmmm szchezuan style shrimp you are like shrimpy corndogs swimming in a warm bath of sugary tart garlic sauce. i love you so much!!
author: Libra J.

description:
When I first moved to the City I lived across the street from this place for a while and honestly tried this place out of convenience (Single in the City, lived alone, large kitchen I did not want to clean and worked 10-12 hours a day) and the food has always been consistently hot and delicious- very flavorful. 

Now- Fast FWD 11 (eleven) years later- Fortunately I have always lived a few miles away from this place- I have lived SOMA, Castro, Twin Peaks and now by State Univ. and they ALWAYS deliver in record time. They have modernized their take out computer system- previously it was always a challenge placing the order and always worried if they actually GOT IT- but they never failed. 

OK- So the CONS- The place looks like a serious Health Code Violation, but I never eat there. Realistically, I am sure many 5 star places kitchens are scarier. The place itself may get a C or D for the dining experience, but an A+ for the food. I really do not know their secret for their food, but it is always steaming hot, flavorful and delicious!!! Always hits the spot and tastes just as good as left overs for you single guys and gals. 

If your looking for an extravagant gourmet environment, try Gary Danko's (and when you leave HUNGRY- Order take out from this place!!!) 

BTW- Its chinese food- All these "foodies" need to RELAX or here's an idea- COOK!!
author: RG P.

description: Yesterday we have order 4 lunches, the food came in time and it was delicious, but 30 or less minutes later everybody was falling asleep and their menu sais that they don't use MSG.
author: Anya M.

description: this is why you don't order sushi delivery. barf.
author: danielle m.

description:
I'm a Jew, (not) a lonely Jew on Christmas
we just saw a movie....
And as in Jewish (and apparently Chinese) culture on Christmas, 
the only logical step is to get Chinese food!

We were told to go to San Tung.  Apparently everyone else was too, cuz it was packed.  So lucky for us May Lee thrives on their take out, they are super small, and had no one inside!

Maybe that would have scared a normal person...but not 2 Jews and a Jew by association on Christmas!  We were brave souls.

Good thing too.  No wait.  Awesome won-ton soup.  General Chicken that was adequate, shrimp in lobster sauce, and a mushu pork that made a pretty tasty burrito....it was a good choice.

Don't come here if you require fancy schmancy service, or ambiance, or nice decor.  Do come here if you want to leave having spent about $10 a person, with a full belly, leftovers and a warm "Merry Christmas" on the way out.

This might be my new take out Chinese spot now too.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Nothing is better then getting piping hot food delivered to your door lickity split when you are starving and stuck, or sick or just plain lazy.

These guys never fail to deliver, literally - the food may be 3ish salty greasy stars but the convenience factor of delivery available *all day* is 4 star worthy.

Curse them for never including chop sticks though *shakes fist*.

PS: I have not and probably never will try their sushi, you are on your own there..
author: GIR ..

description: Awesome lunch specials! I love their Mongolian beef, although sometimes the sauce can be heavy on the salt so I always ask them to skip it. The eggrolls are pretty good too and the prices are very fair. Consistent and dependable for delivery.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Delivery in 10 minutes.  I repeat, delivery took TEN MINUTES.  And even more astounding: the delivery guy looked and acted like neither a rapist nor a WoW addict living in Mommy's basement.

The food?  The chow mien was certainly nothing to get your knickers in a twist over.  however, it does rate slightly above average for the price.

All-in-all: TEN MINUTE DELIVERY!
author: jack p.

description:
I would like to clarify that May Lees' is a Chinese take out or delivery spot not a Japanese dine in experience.

I made the mistake of dining in once since the delivery has always been so flawless. The space is designated for a delivery operation but they have a table for people to post while waiting for pick up, but they will also serve you food as if they offer table service.  Table service and a dining experience is not May Lees specialty it is their fast and delicious Chinese food.  

A couple months ago I received a new menu from May Lees with my order.  Japanese food?!? WTF?!  Well I might as well try it since their Chinese food is so good the sushi rolls must be to, right? wrong!  I went safe and took advantage of the offers they have posted on the menu.  Order $25 or more free egg rolls or soup, $38 or more free rock n roll.  The rolls were the worst ever.  You could tell upon sight they were gonna be bad but I took a bite anyhow, spit it out and threw the remains out.  

The Chinese food is really good, not too saucy, plentiful, fresh, identifiable.  I'm normally not a fan of Chinese food but May Lee's takes out all the stereotypes I have about Chinese food. The won-ton soup is incredible, walnut prawns, Mongolian beef, beef and brocc, cashew chicken, the combo chow mien and chow fun are all on regular rotation in my household when ordering from May Lee's.
author: Frankie F.

description: I got food poisoning from this place. Not to mention their "salmon teriyaki" was breaded and fried. Weird. Beware.
author: Jennie R.

description:
May Lee's delivers to Treasure Island for the win!  Hidden fees?, maybe.

I paid $35 dollars for:
Pot Stickers
Kung Pao Tofu combo
Walnut Prawns combo

The menu is extensive and there are an assortment of tofu-laden vegetable-laden dishes for the vegetarians.  The pot stickers were huge and plentiful, with a delicious filling of meat and just a hint of grease for taste.  Dare I say some of the best potstickers I've had in the city. 

My boyfriend is mad in love with the walnut prawns and orders them consistently.  The Kung Pao tofu was even impressive with the tofu a bit fried but naturally incorporated into the dish.

I once got a chicken noodle dish of lo mein or chow mein or some mein and it was pretty terrible (hence the three stars).  The noodles were crispy and the chicken on the fatty/no-good-meat side.  I personally avoid the noodles here.

Each entree can be made into a combo with a $3.25 charge.  The combo comes with an eggroll, hot and sour soup and rice.  The hot and sour soup is spicy but hearty and not watered down like a lot of Chinese places.  The only hangup was they put our combo sides in the same containers so one big order of soup and one big order of rice.  That works out for us but if you're planning on ordering with friends and taking yours to go, you might want to let them know.

I can't say much for the ordering process.  While the gentleman was kind, we had a lot of communication problems - we could barely hear or understand each other.  It probably added five minutes to the process.

All in all, this is a solid delivery joint.  Especially for the Islanders.
author: Amanda C.

description:
YES!  CHINESE FOOD!  TREASURE ISLAND!  YES!


So, they lose a star for being 45 minutes late (causing our delivery to take 90 minutes total) and they lose a star for weak appetizers, but they gain a star for delivering to treasure island.

While the appetizers (crab puffs and wontons) were a little weak, but this may be because of the length of time we had to wait so the food got soggy.  The entrees were delicious and we enjoyed the fried rice and kung pao tofu, the sweet and sour chicken, etc.  

But they will deliver to me and it tastes good enough, and, frankly, all I know is that I'm gleeful that I have Chinese food when I need it. 

Also - a friend didn't want to stay to watch SYTYCD, so he left and went and picked up food from the same place.  His experience was not only better, but where we had weaker apps, his were fine when they were eaten immediately.
author: Max A.

description:
The Best Chinese Food outside of China.

This place looks like a hole in the wall (and to some extent it is). They primarily do delivery and take out orders, but the quality and price of the food is unbelievable.

Their Mongolian Beef, Garlic Prawns, Sweet & Sour Chicken, and Hot & Sour Soup are to die for.
author: Boris B.

description: May Lee's is easily my favorite Chinese spot in the city. The inside is a little dingy, but the people who own it and work there are pretty nice and serve quickly and politely. The food is enjoyable and really well priced. My friends and I, being the broke college kids we are, order off the lunch special. We're always impressed with how good the food is. Furthermore, our total always comes to under $8, which makes us happy. There are always left overs as well! May Lee's really is a great spot.
author: Marie L.

description: Typical greasy chinese food that you can find on just about any street.
author: Mark S.

description:
THE BEST CHINESE FOOD IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


I LOVE May Lee's! 

In the 13 years I've lived in San Francisco, I have yet to find a better Chinese restaurant. The food is excellent and the delivery times are very fast!

I received a delivery in 10 minutes and I live out at 41st. Avenue. It was fresh and hot when it arrived too. 
They are very friendly too. 

It's better to order from them for delivery. The restaurant it's self is really small and the plates hold less food than the foldpaks that the food is delivered in. 

My favorite is their pot stickers and combination fried rice. They have the BEST fried rice I have ever tasted. 
I compare every Chinese restaurant against May Lee's and few have come close.
author: Larry J.

description:
No exageration, this is the worst chinese food I have ever had. How bad was it? Well the only reason I registered for Yelp was to give this place one star, so you won't have to suffer like I did. Everything had some strange, nasty tinge to it that I don't even have know how to describe besides saying GROSS. It was virtually inedible.

There are plenty of great restaurants in the neighborhood, save yourself the pain and just go elsewhere.
author: Sam W.

description: Food is generally good with quick service and light on the wallet. Nothing too stand outish about it, but is steady good, so you usually can't go wrong.
author: Cove C.

description: Super yummy food for great prices. I grew up with the Chinese half of my family and so I know a thing or two about Chinese food, restaurant and home style. My bf and I ordered delivery, it was fast and very tasty. Perhaps not quite as good as Chinatown restaurant food, but close enough, especially for the price.
author: Christina W.

description: I really love this place. Food is really tasty and staff are very courteous. One of the best Chinese eateries.....I highly recommend this place :)
author: Serene D.

description: This place rocks!!! My coworker and I were looking for a good sushi place that delivers and we found May lees, I got the Miso Soup which was so HOT i almost burned my mouth but it was just so yummy on this rainy Tuesday. I also got the Tempura California roll it was so yummy that I ate it all instead of only half like I originally wanted. I will be going back to may lees soon. :)
author: Veronica V.

description:
I'm writing a review of the Chinese delivery; have never tried their Japanese selection or dined at the restaurant.

They serve the typical food, nothing terribly innovative, but it's consistently good. Their website is very good for ordering for delivery from, and they're very prompt with the delivery. 

A plus is that they have vegetarian hot and sour soup--rather hard to find for delivery. In fact, their vegetarian selection is fairly decent. Just wish they had some green onion pancakes!
author: Melissa M.

description: Great place for take-out. The restaurant is somewhat drafty, I definitely wouldn't stay there, but they are really fast and the food is pretty darn good.
author: Patrick K.

description: We usually get our Chinese delivery from here. Maybe once a month..just when I have a craving for Hot and Sour soup. May Lee's a decent Chinese take-outs place. You can't ask or expect anything more cuz that would be silly. The order usually arrived 30-40 mins after it was placed. Our order usually consist of Hot and Sour soup, Beef and Broccoli, BBQ Pork Fried Rice and Chicken Breast Mongolian. I think with Chinese take-outs you just need to stick with the basic dishes as there are way too many factors for things to go wrong. May Lee's has not gone wrong once with our orders. I like this place.
author: Sara M.

description:
Best Chinese delivery in the city, bar none.

I'm a SF native, born and raised here. My Stepfather is from Guangzhou [Canton] China. I've lived all over the city [and in China for a time] and tried just about every Chinese place here in SF I can think of. 

This place rocks when it comes to *delivery* food. Yes, there are better Chinese restaurants here in the city, but ask them to deliver food as hot, fresh and on time as these guys? It's not going to happen. 

Compared with other restaurants within their price range, this place stands right at the top of the rest of the places here in SF as it pertains to quality.

Yes, like every small take out place they have their strengths and weaknesses.... Every take out/delivery restaurant does. Sometimes spices are hotter then before and sometimes they are not. But compared to every take-out or delivery restaurant I've tried here in the city [regardless of the type of cuisine] May Lee's is VERY consistent.

The food is ALWAYS hot, and freshly cooked. The delivery guys are ALWAYS fast....scary fast as the matter of fact. How they get the food to my place in the time that they do always surprises me. I tend to tip the drivers big because I don't live close to them anymore, and appreciate the effort it takes to come to where I live. They seem to appreciate it, and accordingly continue to provide excellent customer service when I call. 

The restaurant itself is SMALL. I think they have two tables. It's obviously a family-owned place, intended to make it's money on pick-up orders and deliveries [like many Chinese places in China Town]. 

For Chinese delivery at the price point that May Lee's falls into, they get 5 Stars.
author: David P.

description:
soooo my roomies and I order May Lee's like once a week at least...

They chicken chow mein is awesome
