their combo fried rice is awesome
mongolian beef/chicken? awesome... well only when the sauce is dark
walnut prawns? awesome
sweet and sour anything? awesome!
crab rangoon? do i need to say it?

we don't get their sushi because it's a friggin chinese restaurant... so when their sushi isn't on par with ebisu... go fig

may lee's food can get a little pricey sometimes, especially considering we mostly order during lunch... which gives it the downgrade from the 5 star

ask for their wonton soup with wontons fried and on the side... iz goooo
author: Watty Y.

description:
the food is ok THE SERVICE IS AWFUL....i used to like that they were open 365 days a year.... and I'm asian and still cant understand anything they are saying.  They have over charged me in the past, and forgot to bring sauce like 5 times.....
look its not my fault that it was raining and it took you over an hour to get the food to me and ten other hungry people. I have given them many chances, lots of times the order is messed up and always late, no itemized receipt and although we order form them almost every Sunday to the same location they still could not get it right..... 
THE DRIVER CALLED ME A DUMB GIRL. well buddy you just lost a lot of business
author: Jodé L.

description:
We looked in the phone book...made the call....and within less than 30 minutes we had delicious Chinese food for a good price. We didn't even have to leave home, yay!

Yes, May Lee's has calmed our craving for Chinese food. We ordered a few items that stood up to the challenge.
~ Combo Chow Mein: My only beef is that there were not enough shrimp, but that doesn't mean it wasn't delicous! :-)
~ Sesame Chicken: This was different from most of the sesame chicken I've had, but it worked.  I liked that it had it's own style and brought the heat.
~ Sweet & Sour Chicken: It's sweet & sour chicken, not much to say. It was very good though. I have had some sweet and sour chicken dishes that tasted like ass!
~ Hot & Sour Soup: This was one of the best Hot and Sour soups I've ever had. There was a lot of stuff in the soup, including large pieces of mushroom, tofu, and delicious egg.

This wasn't the best Chinese food we've had, but it still was good. My girlfriend and I will definitely be ordering again from May Lee's.  their fast, friendly delivery made it even easier.

A hardy thanks!
author: Nick R.

description:
There food fucken sucks im so fucken pissed off! First of all they fucked up on my order 
the spicy tuna roll wasnt even spicy, the rolls where falling apart. The rice used to make the roll wasnt even sushi rice ( the vinegar rice) it was just regular white rice.

They gave us Tempura Shrimp instead of tempura shrimp roll that we order, jacking up the price. The terriyaki Beef wasnt even grilled it was deep fried and was oily and disguesting. 

Ive had better food at fastfood places in the mall then this shit hole. Do not get food from here its a waste of money.
author: Rod S.

description:
I will preface this with I am a long time May Lee's customer.  We have had their food more times than we can count over the course of three or four years. "So why is she giving them 1 star if she's been going there for years?" Well, the answer is because their food has gone down hill BIG TIME this year. May Lees is not a dine in location, you either take your food to go or you have them deliver, and they are Speedy Gonzales delivery. We live 5 blocks away and we get our order within 10-15 minutes. 
May Lee's used be great because I would get their Chinese and my boyfriend would get their sushi and it was good food, which was good quality AND low cost. But something changed this year. We got food last night and their chicken and beef was inedible. The meat was hard and unappetizing. I pushed the chicken to the side and ate the rest of the food, and this has been consistent over the past few orders.  I would highly recommend finding another spot until they get their act together.
author: Hedieh G.

description:
Food was fresh and very good. Workers were nice. Probably a great take out place. But we dined in and it was freezing. First thing I noticed when I walked in was that all of the staff were wearing down coats. I mean "see your breath" cold. We'd have gone elsewhere but had a show to catch and were pressed for time.
Big thumbs down on dining in house, at least in Winter.
JP
author: james p.

description: This place has been around forever! I grew up across the street and this was always one of my favorite places to get to-go Chinese. Good food and great prices!
author: Melanie D.

description:
I used to live just 3 buildings away from this place.  But, this place did not exist when I lived in the neighborhood, otherwise, I'd surely would've tried it by now.  
On a whim, we stopped for take-out and I recognized a dude going back into the house next door to my old apt building.  I couldn't believe he still lived there after all these years....
Back to May Lee's.  A hole in the wall smack in the middle of 7th Avenue with nothing but residential buildings.  Like a pineapple in the middle of a ski slope.  There are 2 tables for 4 and one more in the back which the staff was using to make eggrolls and won ton (the ingredients were laid out on the table).  
Evidently, they do most of their business in take-out.  The driver came back in his down jacket, washed his hands and proceeded to help out in the kitchen (still with his down jacket on, probably ready for a quick get away when he has to hit the road to deliver).  It's a mom-pop business with delivery all over the city she told me, even Treasure Island for an extra $4.00 fee and minimum $10 purchase.  No checks accepted, credit cards OK.
We took home the lunch specials (M-Sa before 4PM) of Mongolian beef ($6.25) over rice which was more yellow and green onions than beef.  It was spicy enough but not memorable; combo chow mein ($6.50) which was soggy and had beef, chicken and fried shrimp in it (didn't like this one) and broccoli beef over rice ($5.95) which was OK.   
I'm not sure what type of restaurant it is, as they serve sushi/Japanese food too (nigiri, sashimi, maki roll, vegan & combo sushi/sashimi)  Everyone in the kitchen was speaking Cantonese.  
Didn't need to use the bathroom but I did hear a dad ask for soap for his daughters to wash their hands.  That was enough to make me not wanna use the bathroom.
author: Ry T.

description: We've ordered delivery from May Lee's for years.  Have never been to the actual restaurant because delivery is so convenient.  The food is always delicious and they throw in a free item for $25 and $45 orders.  For $25, they throw in free egg rolls or fried wontons.  They just started offering ONLINE ordering (www.mayleerestaurant.com) and it works great!  Love this place.
author: Dexter L.

description: I ordered using their online system on their website directly.  My husband and I went to pick up the food, and the man in charge there rudely insisted there was no way we had ordered food.  It wasn't until I showed him the confirmation email I had, that he changed his mind insisting that I had asked for delivery, and that the food was on its way to my house.  Once I showed him in the email showing that I had asked to pick it up he had to call his driver to bring it back to the restaurant, while we waited there.  Fine, OK, we got our food and while we were annoyed we moved on.  Next stop sitting down to eat with family, my husbands orange chicken is missing.  We had a lot of food so we went with out, and after dinner I called the store to tell them it was missing, and I was coming back because I wanted my money back.  The man on the phone just kept saying that he would send me orange chicken now, and didn't want to listen when I said I no longer wanted the food.  So we showed up at the restaurant for my refund and the same man that was difficult at the beginning was there, and insisted the orange chicken wasn't missing, basically calling me a liar when I assured him it was not in our bag.  He then proceeded to huff and puff when giving me my money back.  Overall I will not be returning here ever, while the food was OK enough, the service was so terrible.  Not to to mention, the inside of the restaurant leaves much to be desired in the way of perceived cleanliness.  Sorry May Lee's, I used to really like your place, but you've surely lost us as customers.
author: Kristen B.

description:
we ordered food around 11:35am. and it came arround 12pm. holy shit!! that was fast!  

food is okay. i dont know where all these 5 stars are coming from. maybe i'm ordering the wrong thing? i ordered the shrimp and scallop lunch special over fried rice. their fried rice was ummmm... eh... lets just say im not ordering it next time. the shrimp and scallop...eh...it wasnt all that. and it didnt really impress me.  

almost forgot about the sushi. since our lunch order was over $28, they gave us a free california roll. WARNING: DO NOT ORDER SUSHI FROM HERE!!!  ugh. shits gross.  i was reluctant to try it at first. but since it was FREE... i was curious to see what it tasted like. NOTE: curiosity killed the cat! but good thing cats have 9 lives. so let that be a lesson to you.  never again, my friend!

2 stars for quick delivery, cheap lunch prices and huge portions.
author: B B.

description: May Lee's is kind of a hole-in-the-wall place. The food is pretty good, although there is definitely better quality Chinese food in SF. The best thing is that they deliver, are always prompt (even early) with the food. I don't think I've actually been inside the restaurant because we've always had food delivered! If you're looking for decent Chinese food, good prices, and door-to-door service, this is your kind of place.
author: Teresa S.

description: I order from May Lee on at least a weekly basis.  Except for a few notable exceptions, the delivery time is very quick and delicious.  I generally don't go for delivery sushi, but theirs is quite good and probably better than the Chinese cuisine they offer.  They take good care of me, so four stars.  One subtracted for that time they made me wait for three fucking hours.  It happens.  I would check it out if I were you.
author: Hebrew K.

description: All of the yelping got me curious about this place. I noticed most of the comments were for delivery which I am suspicious of so I walked there and ordered. As I looked around I noticed there was quite a bit of food on the floor and the place is coated in a layer of grease. There is cardboard over the rubber mats in the kitchen apparently to soak up the grease but I don't think that is considered sanitary. The guy hand-making some kind of dumplings sneezed a few times and wiped his hands with a paper towel but did not wash them. I did eat the food I ordered which was pretty average but all I could think of later was how filthy the kitchen was and if I was hours away from contacting the norovirus.
author: Chris H.

description: The only place I've found that delivers Japanese food at lunch time on weekdays! I work in an area where there are no stores or restaurants walkable on a half hour lunch break and Japanese food is one of my favorites, so was delighted to find May Lee's has a Chinese menu as well as a Japanese menu. 3 stars for the quality of the Chinese food, 3.5 stars for the quality of the Japanese food (it's very average), 2 stars for the for the lady who takes the phone orders and usually gets something wrong, 5 stars for the super nice guy who delivers the food! He's really the main reason I keep coming back to this place (along with the fact that no one else delivers Japanese lunch that I can find).
author: Mark C. J.

description:
Fastest delivery in San Francisco!
Food was delivered hot and fresh 20 minutes after i ordered.
The Walnut Prawns and Mongolian Beef are definitely the best in the city.
Also, i love the fried rice and chow mein. It's non greasy unlike other chinese take outs.
author: Don R.

description: I use to order here when I lived out in shitty Pacific Heights.  Their take out is normal dirty, non-authentic Chinese take out.  I use to order their pan fried noodles.  I haven't been back since I moved out of the hell hole Pacific Heights.  I hate that place.
author: Fatty A.

description: Okay, so getting this delivered was a little expensive but it was johnny on the spot and it was GOOD.  I LOVE walnut prawns and these were really, really good.  I also had some fried rice and crab wonton thingies.  It was all WAY too much for me to eat but it was REALLY good.
author: Bree W.

description: Oh my,  the lunch specials are good! Great deal, food is hot and fresh, steam pouring off the plate, steaming my sneses as chopsticks swim their way to sizzling scallops, shrimp, or mongolian beef (chicken too). I place it in my mouth, taste buds squeezing in an embrace of genious cuisine. Not fancy, not the latest trend, simply good food
author: Aidan G.

description: Random take-out Chinese restaurant in the Inner Sunset. They have tables inside, but I've never actually seen people eat-in. The food is your standard greasy Chinese take-out fare. Speedy, but I would rather order from Andy's.
author: Richie K.

description: I was excited to eat here because there is a place in mill valley with the same logo that has fresh & pretty good chinese. I was mistaken-- gross. Just gross. This was so bad I threw it away and ate something else. I can't believe it is still in business.
author: N A.

description: i don't like sushi, but was having an awkward craving.  I ordered three rolls and was reminded why i don't like sushi.  I thought the prices were a bit steep for what i saw in my to go box.... maybe i don't know anything about sushi prices...
author: william c.

description:
i'm a pretty big proprieter of andy's chinese over on 9th and judah, so when two friends insisted i go here, i resisted until caving in was the option. 

so glad i did. i was sick so we ordered the hot and spicy soup - a great balance of both of those tastes. then came the sweet and sour pork, beef and broccoli, and fat noodles with veggies - all well cooked and prepared, tasty down to the last bite. i was secretly hoping andy himself was not paying attention to my blasphemous ways. the best part was for four people, three main dishes, a soup, and three sides of rice was $30. ridic. i so love these guys...
author: Jenz y.

description: First of all.. I give this restaurant just 1 star. Reasons being that the place looks filthy. I don't understand how you would be able to secialize in Chinese and Japanese food. Honestly to me, if your going to to open an Asian restaurant, make sure it's within one type of food. Also the food seems very cheap and too greasy. I would rather eat at Panda Express.
author: Andre S.

description:
For a standard Chinese take out restaurant that delivers, you should already know the deal. Nasty cold food with 50 minute waits when the restaurant is only up the block.

Not this place though!
 I order from here so much they already know who I am (For the Sex and the City fans: When Miranda orders at the Chinese restaurant and the lady with the annoying laugh remembers her order). 

The Mongolian Beef and Orange Chicken lunch special is delicious. The food's really cheap and you get a decent amount to fill you up. Delivery only takes around 15-20 minutes, and unlike most Chinese take-out, the staff isn't rude!

One note: Please don't get the chicken wings.
author: T C.

description: There's nothing worse than biting halfway into a piece of sushi and feeling your teeth stop...they didn't take the skin off the fish. The miso soup had no tofu...the mushu pancakes were excessively chewy....Noodles were passable but not much flavor....it wasn't cheap either. I was really looking forward to this delivery but now I just feel...ack.
author: chrissy d.

description: So I LOVE sweet n sour chicken and decided to stop in for lunch and this place really had some of the best sweet n sour chicken ever. Not to mention that going in at lunch is SUPER affordable. They gave me half a plate of the chicken (with more meat than vegetable fillers YAY!) and half a plate of white rice. It was HUGE portions. Plus they give you an egg roll, soup of the day, and free tea. All of this cost 6 bux AFTER tax. It was crazy. I don't know much about their delivery or dinner prices but for a cheap yummy lunch with great portions this is THE place to go. Super fast too.
author: Jennifer D.

description: they're half a block from my flat and will make for me whatever i describe? great for those nights when i'm feeling REALLY lazy.
author: Friedrich G.

description: typical cheap chinese place.  greasy, shady chicken, and very salty.  i went here cause it was less than a block from home, but other than that there is really no reason to.
author: vlad k.

description:
i agree with the yuck!

we had food delivered once, about 5 years ago from here.  
it was awful.  we didn't eat it, and we've never gone back
and we won't be going back.
author: Mom Of Three L.

description: The food was not great, but I've definitely had worse Chinese food. I had delivery and I'm not sure why everyone else says they're fast, because it took them almost an hour and 45 minutes to deliver our food and only to north beach!!  Needless to say, it wasn't very hot by the time we finally got it!
author: Jessica N.

description: Excellent food. We've been ordering here for about a year. They now have sushi, and the California rolls excellent. Gave it minus a star because the restaurant itself is a pit.
author: John H.
